intro: Rhynchosia acuminatissima, commonly known as the sharp-pointed burr legume, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its compound leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that are followed by distinctive, spiny pods. The plant is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woodlands. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and has a climbing or trailing growth habit. Rhynchosia acuminatissima is sometimes used in traditional medicine and can be an invasive species in certain areas.
